definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Kang/Kang, one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: The development and application of Al-Sc alloy were briefly discussed.
sentences.chinese: 簡要闡述了鋁鈧合金的開發應用前景。

sentences.english: In this paper, an outline of their military and civil potential applications were also presented.
sentences.chinese: 本文還綜述了含鈧鋁合金在軍事和民品方面的應用。

sentences.english: Characteristics of Scandate cathodes with Scandia doped tungsten bodies have been investigated in this work.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究具有氧化鈧摻雜鎢基體鈧酸鹽陰極的性能。

sentences.english: Characteristics of Scandate cathodes with Scandia doped tungsten bodies have been investigated in this work.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究具有氧化鈧摻雜鎢基體鈧酸鹽陰極的性能。

sentences.english: The experimental results show that scandia distributed evenly on the surface of tungsten particles.
sentences.chinese: 實驗結果表明，氧化鈧均勻分佈在鎢顆粒表面。

sentences.english: This paper describes a rapid method for the separation and determination of microgram amounts of scandium and thorium.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出一萃取分離和測定微克量鈧與釷的快速方法。

sentences.english: They turned out to be the undiscovered elements scandium, gallium, technetium and germanium.
sentences.chinese: 那時還沒發現的元素就是鈧，鎵，鍺和鍀。

sentences.english: With scandium and yttrium, they make up the rare earth metals.
sentences.chinese: 加上鈧和釔，一起組成稀土金屬。

sentences.english: However these ions did not interfere the separation and determination of scandium.
sentences.chinese: 共存金屬離子不干擾鈧的分離和測定。

definition: to fill up or cover up a hole
old variant of 潰|溃[kui4]/to fester/to ulcerate
